question: You have just read about a computer course that really interests you, but it is only for people who have completed an elementary course.Write a letter to the college enrolment officer. In your letterexplain why you are writingdescribe your circumstancesask if a special exception can be made for you so you can enrol in the courseYou do NOT need to write any addresses. Begin your letter as follows:Dear
text: I am writing this letter to express my interest in the computer course as I want to learn and obtain a good software job in the competitive market. In addition, I have a strong determination to learn this course and I am sure that I can learn very quickly with good confidence.

Basically, I did my graduation and looked for summer training caps to improve my software knowledge and skills. Despite my part-time job's busy schedule, I am ready to put my efforts and extend my time to learn this course. This training is much needed for my family as I need to look after my parents and kids as well.

Hoping that I will get  admission into this course  I would request you to please consider my profile on your list as I am coming from a very poor family with  great future planning. Please feel free to ask me if any additional information is required as part of the verification and I am happy to submit a reference from my current employer as well.
I look forward to hearing your response to this letter and hoping that I will be selected for this course.
